description: Meeting needs without compromising the future.

slides.title: What is Sustainability?
slides.content:
# Forever â™¾ï¸

Meeting the needs of the present without compromising the ability of future generations to meet their own needs.
- Three Pillars: **Environment**, **Economy**, **Society**.

slides.title: The Triple Bottom Line
slides.content:
# 3 Ps âš–ï¸

Companies should measure success by:
1. **People**: Social responsibility.
2. **Planet**: Environmental stewardship.
3. **Profit**: Economic viability.

slides.title: Renewable vs Non-Renewable
slides.content:
# Resources ğŸª¨

- **Renewable**: Replenished naturally (Sun, Wind, Timber - if managed).
- **Non-Renewable**: Finite supply (Oil, Coal, Rare Earth Metals).

slides.title: Circular Economy
slides.content:
# Loop it ğŸ”„

Moving away from "Take-Make-Waste".
- Designing products to be repaired, reused, and recycled.
- Waste from one process becomes food for another.

slides.title: SDGs
slides.content:
# Global Goals ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡³

UN Sustainable Development Goals (17 Goals).
- No Poverty, Zero Hunger, Clean Water, Climate Action.
- Blueprint for a better world by 2030.

slides.title: Economy Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Which economic model focuses on designing out waste?

slides.title: Life Cycle Assessment (LCA)
slides.content:
# Cradle to Grave âš°ï¸

Assessing environmental impact of a product from raw material extraction to disposal.
- Mining $\to$ Manufacturing $\to$ Transport $\to$ Use $\to$ Landfill.

slides.title: Sustainable Agriculture
slides.content:
# Green Farming ğŸšœ

- **Permaculture**: Mimicking nature.
- **Crop Rotation**: Keeping soil healthy.
- **Drip Irrigation**: Saving water.
- Reducing pesticides.

slides.title: Water Footprint
slides.content:
# Hidden Water ğŸ’§

Amount of water used to produce goods.
- 1 Cotton Shirt = 2,700 Liters.
- 1 kg Beef = 15,000 Liters.
- Consuming smartly saves water.

slides.title: Fair Trade
slides.content:
# Ethical Buying â˜•

Ensuring producers (farmers) in developing countries get a fair price.
- Better working conditions.
- No child labor.
- Look for the logo.

slides.title: Greenwashing
slides.content:
# Fake News ğŸ¤¥

Companies claiming to be eco-friendly when they are not.
- "Natural" labels with no meaning.
- Vague promises.
- Be a critical consumer.

slides.title: Planned Obsolescence
slides.content:
# Built to Break ğŸšï¸

Designing goods to fail quickly so you buy new ones.
- Unreplaceable batteries.
- Fast fashion.
- Enemy of sustainability.

slides.title: Action Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Which practice involves buying products that ensure fair wages for farmers?

slides.title: Biomimicry
slides.content:
# Copying Nature ğŸ¦

Solving human problems by imitating nature's designs.
- Velcro (Burrs from plants).
- Bullet train (Kingfisher beak).
- Nature has 3.8 billion years of R&D.

slides.title: Urban Sustainability
slides.content:
# Smart Cities ğŸ™ï¸

- Public transit.
- Bike lanes.
- Green spaces.
- Vertical farming.
- Reducing reliance on cars.

slides.title: Tragedy of the Commons
slides.content:
# Shared Resource ğŸ£

Individuals acting in self-interest deplete a shared resource.
- Overfishing international waters.
- Solution: Regulation and privatization.

slides.title: Carbon Offsets
slides.content:
# Balancing Act âš–ï¸

Paying to remove $CO_2$ to cancel out your emissions.
- Planting trees.
- Funding wind farms.
- Should be last resort (Reduce first!).

slides.title: Degrowth
slides.content:
# Less is More ğŸ“‰

Theory that infinite economic growth is impossible on a finite planet.
- Focus on well-being instead of GDP.
- Prioritizing quality of life over material consumption.

slides.title: Sustainability Summary
slides.content:
# Recap ğŸ“

- It's about **Balance**.
- **Reduce, Reuse, Recycle** (in that order).
- Every choice you make has an impact.
- We have one planet.
